column4: Can someone help me? It says  I can't save a file in a certain place because I'm not root, but I'm using the account I installed Ubuntu with.
what is the output of this command: groups
kevin adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin
what does this command return: sudo echo hi
sudo suddenly started working o.O It returned hi
ok, does your gksudo command from before work now?
Yes. It opened some odd window.
you can use that to edit and then save with ctrl-o and exit with ctrl-x.  I'm not sure why your gksudo isn't working, but we can troubleshoot some more after you exit nano
How do I make a new file with this?
when you do    nano /new/file    it will create it
